article_title: Ohio among ‘hot spots’ hit by colon cancer
article_text:

article_metadata.description: Although the risk of death from colorectal cancer in the United States has dropped dramatically in recent decades, there are three “hot spots” in Appalachia and the rural South where death rates are “unnecessarily high,” researchers said.
